lines: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc89dd60>
author: Richard David Bach

lines: Appreciation is a wonderful thing. It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc89d5e0>
author: Voltaire

lines: What counts can’t always be counted; what can be counted doesn’t always count. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc89cfa0>
author: Albert Einstein

lines: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc89c320>
author: Mark Twain

lines: It's not so much how busy you are, but why you are busy. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc89ba60>
author: Mary Flannery O'Connor

lines: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc89b560>
author: Pablo Picasso

lines: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc89b060>
author: Joseph Campbell

lines: The purpose of life is a life of purpose. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc89aa20>
author: Robert Byrne

lines: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc89a520>
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

lines: Have patience with all things, but, first of all with yourself. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc899b20>
author: Saint Francis de Sales

lines: Patience is not simply the ability to wait—it's how we behave while we're waiting.  #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8975a0>
author: Joyce Meyer

lines: Great difficulties may be surmounted by patience and perseverance. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc896f60>
author: Abigail Adams

lines: Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.  #<Author:0x00007ff4dc896a60>
author: Saadi

lines: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8a7bd0>
author: Theodor Seuss Geisel

lines: If you see someone without a smile, give them one of yours. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8a6690>
author: Dolly Parton

lines: Sometimes your joy is the source of your smile, and sometimes your smile is the source of your joy. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8a4750>
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

lines: A warm smile is the universal language of kindness. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8a4110>
author: William Arthur Ward

lines: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8a3c10>
author: Joseph Addison

lines: Do not judge me by my success, judge me by how many times I fell down and got back up again. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8a3710>
author: Nelson Mandela

lines: Don’t let a bad day trick you into thinking you have a bad life. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8a2310>
author: Allie Newman

lines: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8a0a10>
author: C.S. Lewis

lines: Sometimes, carrying on, just carrying on, is the superhuman achievement. #<Author:0x00007ff4dc8a0150>
author: Albert Camus

lines: Life doesn’t get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4df3d0>
author: Steve Maraboli

lines: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap, but by the seeds that you plant. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4ddfd0>
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

lines: We cannot always build the future for our youth, but we can build our youth for the future.  #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4dd710>
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

lines: Chance favors the prepared mind. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4dd0d0>
author: Louis Pasteur

lines: Give me six hours to chop down a tree, and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4dc450>
author: Abraham Lincoln

lines: It’s better to look ahead and prepare, than to look back and regret. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4db7d0>
author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

lines: There are no problems we cannot solve together, and very few that we can solve by ourselves. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4da8d0>
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

lines: We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors; we borrow it from our children. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4d7590>
author: Native American Proverb

lines: We say 'things will turn out', but no. It's what we do that actually creates the future. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4d5510>
author: Mae Jemison

lines: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, one finds it attached to the rest of the world. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4d3350>
author: John Muir

lines: Let us develop respect for all living things. Let us try to replace violence and intolerance with understanding, compassion and love. #<Author:0x00007ff4dd4d2450>
author: Jane Goodall
